metadata.name: Suspicious Workstation Locking via Rundll32
metadata.comment: Detects a suspicious call to the user32.dll function that locks the user workstation

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\rundll32.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('rundll32.exe') AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\cmd.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('user32.dll,')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('lockworkstation')))

output.summary: Detects a suspicious call to the user32.dll function that locks the user workstation

metadata.objective: Examine fields: process.name, process.parent_process.name False positive: Scripts or links on the user desktop used to lock the workstation instead of Windows+L or the menu option Reference: https://app.any.run/tasks/2aef9c63-f944-4763-b3ef-81eee209d128/
